alert.note: Alert for Kings (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 7:34PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following county, Kings (Brooklyn). * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas, and ponding of water in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain of 1 to 2 inches due to earlier thunderstorms. - Some locations that could still experience flooding include... Flatbush, Crown Heights, Canarsie, Bay Ridge, Brooklyn Heights, Park Slope, Bensonhurst, Sheepshead Bay and Greenpoint. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
